channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Schumer to ask Senate to back legal action over partial Epstein files release
item.description: Top Democrat to introduce resolution after Department of Justice misses deadline for all files linked to sex offender US politics – live updates The S...

item.title: New York school board investigates wooden ‘timeout’ box allegations
item.description: Governor calls accusations that students with disabilities may have been confined in boxes ‘highly disturbing’ A school district board in upstate New ...

item.title: Vince Zampella, co-creator of Call of Duty video game series, dies aged 55
item.description: Game developer, who was also involved in Medal of Honor and Titanfall, reportedly killed in a car crash Vince Zampella, the co-creator of the Call of ...

item.title: Australia news live: NSW lower house passes anti-protest laws; Greens and pro-Palestine groups plan constitutional challenge
item.description: The Liberals voted with Labor to pass the legislation last night, while the Nationals opposed the bill. Follow live updates Get our breaking news emai...

item.title: Epstein survivors call out Trump’s justice department for ‘extreme redactions’ in latest file release – live
item.description: The statement says the release was ‘a fraction of the files, and what we received was riddled with abnormal and extreme redactions with no explanation...

item.title: Russia escalates attacks on key Ukrainian region of Odesa
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky warned the attacks were an attempt by Moscow to block Ukraine's access to maritime logistics.

item.title: Third Palestine Action hunger striker on remand ends protest
item.description: A third individual on remand for alleged offences relating to the Palestine Action group has ended a hunger strike after 49 days.

item.title: Baby followed by BBC back in Gaza hospital after treatment abroad
item.description: The BBC revisits one-year-old Siwar Ashour who was temporarily evacuated to Jordan for medical treatment during the Gaza war.

item.title: Two men jailed for Grindr targeted thefts
item.description: The two men took cash, phones and passwords after arranging to meet their targets at home.

item.title: US pauses offshore wind projects over security concerns
item.description: The Trump administration has long opposed wind power, most often citing cost and reliability concerns.
